source.faaddb5c:
def plot_hist(variable):
    plt.figure(figsize=(20,20))
    plt.hist(data[variable],bins=50)
    plt.xlabel(variable)
    plt.ylabel("Frequency")
    plt.title("{} distribution with hist".format(variable))
    plt.show()
    
numericVar=["Attack","Defense","HP","Sp.Attack","Sp.Defense","Speed","Total"]
for i in numericVar:
    plot_hist(i)

data=data.rename(columns={"Primary Type":"Primaryt"})
element_list=list(data["Primaryt"].unique())
for i in element_list:
    print(i)
labels=data.Primaryt.value_counts().index
sizes=data.Primaryt.value_counts().values
plt.figure(figsize=(20,20))
plt.pie(sizes,labels=labels,autopct="%1.2f%%")
plt.title("Frequency of Primary Elements")

source.01be9d66:
## Introduction 
Pokemon is a cartoon and game series created by Satoshi Tajiri in 1996 through the Nintendo company. Pokemon are small creatures in the pokemon universe, and the purpose of the characters is to trap the pokemon in this universe with special equipment called poke balls and then fight them with other pokemon. In this data set, we will examine pokemon and their stats.
### Contents
1. [Load and Check Data] (#1)
source.4943ce62:
### Variable Description
1. **Name:** Name of pokemons
2. **Name2:** Name of pokemons after evolved
3. **Primary Type:** Special element of pokemon
4. **Secondary Type:** Special second element of pokemon if it exists
5. **Attack:** Indicator of Strength
6. **Defense:** Indicator of Durability against an attack
7. **HP:** Indicator of Hit Points
8. **Sp. Attack:** Indicator of Strength of special move
9. **Sp. Defense:** Indicator of Durability against a special move
10. **Speed:** Determines priority of who will attack first 
11. **Total:** Sum of every indicator of power
